title: Joe/Hunter Biden Email Records

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Joe/Hunter Biden Email Records
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Any and all records containing the email messages to and from the President Joseph Robinette Biden and his son Robert Hunter Biden detailing dealings with Ukraine - Burisma firms.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anthony Schaeffer

communications.communication:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

title: GoGuardian - Lists, Alerts

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records related to the school district's use of GoGuardian technology:

1) A list of all website names,  URLs and keywords that are blacklisted/blocked by the district's GoGuardian web-filtering software.
2) A list of all website names,  URLs and keywords that the district has manually whitelisted/allowed access to upon request through the GoGuardian web-filtering software.

Please note that items 1 and 2 are usually available through an Excel file called GoGuardian_Filters.xlsx. We have received this information from other schools in this format. 

3) All alerts generated by GoGuardian software from January 1, 2020 through November 18, 2022. Please redact any identifying information. This includes the following types of alert documents, usually available as Excel files:
a. Beacon
b. Flagged activity
c. Smart alerts
d. Policy export 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Dave Maass
Director of Investigations
Electronic Frontier Foundation

title: FOIA Request

communications.subject: Illinois Freedom of Information Act. Request: FOIA Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Illinois Freedom of Information Act., I hereby request the following records:

Dear FOIA Officer:
 
This is a request under the Freedom of Information Act requesting copies of all records, including video, audio, emails, texts, and other similar documents, whether sent from or received on official or personal equipment in relation to the shooting of 31-year-old Londre Sylvester on July 9, 2021 Saturday 9 pm near Cook County Jail. He was shot 64 times in the parking lot.
 
This request includes but is not limited to the following: missing persons report, any crime scene photos/videos, 911 calls, cell phone video, case files, incident reports, police reports, interrogation videos/audio, autopsy reports, missing person report, police interrogation video for other people involved in the shootout, and police video of arrests, copies of any POD Camera video, video or photo surveillance, and any associated documentation.

I am a producer with Vice News, this request is made for the purpose of news gathering and not for commercial use.
 
I request a waiver of all fees since this request is being made in the interest of the public and will contribute significantly to the public’s understanding of the operations and activities related to this former public official’s activities. 
 
I request an expedited processing of this request as this information provides great value to public interest and thus is time sensitive. 
 
Sincerely,
Rafa Farihah, 
Vice News, Associate Producer

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Jennifer Solorio

title: EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT - Verification of reduced administrative staff in 2022

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT - Verification of reduced administrative staff in 2022
communications.communication:
EATONVILLE SCHOOL DISTRICT - Verification of reduced administrative staff in 2022

12-16-22

via email to: public.records@eatonville.wednet.edu

To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

REQUEST FOR COMMUNICATIONS AND WRITINGS - ALL ELECTRONIC MAIL (E-MAIL), ELECTRONIC TEXTS, and ELECTRONIC RECORDS referencing the following subjects/or topics for the period of time between January 1, 2022 - December 16,2022:

Reduced Staff, Reduction in staff, administrative Staff reductions, retirements, layoffs, firings, open positions, full head count, reduced head count, delays due to reduced staff, and any records regarding full or reduced administrative staffing for your agency in 2022.

Please include  in any reasonable search for responsive records a search of the following email accounts:

GARY NEAL - SUPERINTENDENT - g.neal@eatonville.wednet.edu
KIMBERLY HENLEY - EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT - k.henley@eatonville.wednet.edu
LINDSAY FITZER - HR & PAYROLL SPECIALIST - l.fitzer@eatonville.wednet.edu
CAROLYN CAMERON - ACCOUNTS PAYABLE - c.cameron@eatonville.wednet.edu
KALINDA LEWIS - HR COORDINATOR - k.lewis@eatonville.wednet.edu
AMANDA SMITH - EXECUTIVE ASSISTANT - a.m.smith@eatonville.wednet.edu
TERESA ROLFE - HUMAN RESOURCE ASSISTANT & SKYWARD - t.rolfe@eatonville.wednet.edu
PAMELA STRUB - PAYROLL & BENEFITS - p.strub@eatonville.wednet.edu


With respect to requests for records that include "communications," I am requesting all emails, text messages, and electronic records, regardless the type of device or account from which the communication was generated or where the device or data is stored (including personal devices such as personal cell phones, laptops, tablets, and/or computers etc. used from home to conduct public business during the COVID-19 Pandemic). Nissen v. Pierce County, 183 Wa.2d 863 (2015).

With respect to requests for records that include "Writings" per 42.56.010(4) this means handwriting, typewriting, printing, photostating, photographing, and every other means of recording any form of communication or representation including, but not limited to, letters, words, pictures, sounds, or symbols, or combination thereof, and all papers, maps, magnetic or paper tapes, photographic films and prints, motion picture, film and video recordings, magnetic or punched cards, discs, drums, diskettes, sound recordings, and other documents including existing data compilations from which information may be obtained or translated.

I also request a detailed contemporaneous log to be provided for any document withheld or redacted.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, via e-mail attachment format or unprotected internet cloud link if possible, or on USB FLASH DRIVE or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter.

I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

title: Lead contamination pictures (Oakland Planning & Building Dept.)

communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Lead contamination pictures (Oakland Planning & Building Dept.)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Requesting copies of all photographs related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

Specifically requesting copies of all photographs related to the 2019 lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, owned by Donald and Era Farnsworth of Oakland California, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

Release of the following records, photographs or documents is requested:

1) Requesting copies of all photographs sent as an email attachment to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released an electronic document named RSchimm_Emails_Redacted.pdf, containing an email sent to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The email of October 8, 2019 describes lead contaminated conditions at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, after uncontained power sanding of lead based paint was performed. The email of October 8, 2019 states "Dust is spreading, tenants and neighbors don't know. None of the tenants have received pamphlets", "Dust has escaped the work area to tenants and neighbors space" and "Pictures are enclosed." Release of all pictures referenced within or attached to the email of October 8, 2019 is requested. 

2) Requesting copies of all photographs sent as an email attachment to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Monday, November 4, 2019 , with the Subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Case # 19045.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released an electronic document named RSchimm_Emails_Redacted.pdf, containing an email sent to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Monday, November 4, 2019, with the Subject: Re: [EXTERNAL] Case # 19045.

The email of November 4, 2019 describes concerns over unsafe lead-based work practices at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606. The email of November 4, 2019 states "contamination of new areas", "area left covered with dust, chips and a dirty work glove for the entire weekend", "Waste was not secured in a locked area, bags are covered with dust" and "Pictures are attached." Release of all pictures referenced within or attached to the email of November 4, 2019 is requested. 

3) Requesting copies of all photographs taken on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, at the onsite inspection performed by City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606.

In response to public records request #19-6316 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/19-6316 the City of Oakland released a
Record Detail with Inspection Log related to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The Inspection Log contains notes related to the onsite inspection performed by City of Oakland Code Enforcement Officer Randy Schimm on Tuesday, October 8, 2019, at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606. The inspection log states "photos taken, violation verified. Lead based paint being ground off the building without proper containment methods" and "Paint chips, dust and debris being scattered all over site". Release of all photographs taken at the October 8, 2019 onsite inspection at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563, is requested.

4) Requesting copies of all additional photographs related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563, which depict the lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, owned by Donald and Era Farnsworth of Oakland California. Additionally requesting copies of all additional photographs which depict the lead contamination of properties neighboring the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

In response to public records request #20-7783 described at https://oaklandca.nextrequest.com/requests/20-7783 the City of Oakland released a Notice of Violation, Stop Work Order, and eight photographs accompanying the documents, related to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The Stop Work Order dated October 8, 2019 describes "Hazardous lead based paint removal and contamination of local area & beyond." The Notice of Violation dated October 12, 2019 describes "Lead based paint debris being contaminating soil and side of building." and "causing lead based paint to contaminate neighboring properties and soil". Requesting release of all photographs which depict the lead contamination at the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563. Additionally requesting copies of all photographs which depict the lead contamination of properties neighboring the property located at 262 Athol Avenue, Oakland Ca. 94606, related to but not limited to City of Oakland Code Enforcement Case Number 1904563.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Anders Maxdale

title: Holocaust Surveys

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Holocaust Surveys
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

By way of background, on August 10, 2022, Governor Kathy Hochul signed into law Chapter 490 of the Laws of 2022 requiring a survey regarding instruction on the Holocaust within New York State public school districts. Through the survey, superintendents are required to attest that the district is teaching about the Holocaust appropriately as part of classroom instruction aligned with the NYS Social Studies Learning Standards and §801 of Education Law. 

In October 2022, Deputy Commissioner Angelique Johnson-Dingle sent a memo to public school superintendents including a copy of that survey and instructions for accessing and submitting the survey via the SED Monitoring and Vendor Performance System in the NYSED Business Portal.

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law, I hereby request all of the Holocaust Instruction Survey responses submitted this year. 

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Russel Neiss

title: Virginia DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Virginia DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Virginia Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Tom Nash, a citizen of Virginia, in coordination with Wayne Byun.

Wyoming Department of Corrections ************************************************************************ Your first Wyoming Department of Corrections record request (request number #22-289) has been submitted. It is currently unpublished and is not available for the general public to view. In compliance with the Wyoming Public Records Act, this letter is your 7 day response to your request for access to public records which was received by Wyoming Department of Corrections (WDOC) on the date listed in this response.  The WDOC is compiling and reviewing the records in response to your request.  The WDOC must extend the response time of your request from seven (7) days to thirty (30) days due to the high volume of public record request we receive.  Once prepared, fee payment is due if needed.  You will be notified if any fees apply and any work that is completed that requires no charge will be provided.    Please do not hesitate to contact the WDOC through this system if we can be of further assistance. communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 

 
 
RE: PUBLIC RECORDS ACT REQUEST December 15, 2022, Reference # M007425-121522 

Dear Mercy Loyo, 

This letter is in response to your Public Records Act request dated December 15, 2022 in which you requested the following records: 
"a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 
b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021." 

The CA Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation has reviewed its files and has determined it has no public records that are responsive to your request. California Department of Corrections and Rehabilitation eliminates inmate copayments for health care services (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HaPgp3Cl0ukLs9Oj2-2B6Y7kWm7qxZi2QGUcaFp0R4FEg-2Bj-2Bdiq0-2F23nuh8-2FEYv9UzNpQ27igO0rWK89bCndnSyfdZt1EcBr0v3fOCL-2F-2BokH11bVigFa3ROtUnaEBVd1vtaWdoKVL85uKya-2F8dZPUas9I68lT8AuL304ZbQkhZo2v-2FgxVAhQtOeI1yzBH1KUQdLA-3D-3DMisv_O-2BtWgZ6bhFAUZ6GWLp-2BDKdZBQSToEcNXH1gHK-2BQHG2ku51XyIsPMsAIdDQG5DCO3uI728XSQix-2Bf0z8qB6ECrNvInOyfgn6C4Wj1db-2BJJo0XpMhHZbe-2B-2F0G0fbFpRfXbhK1xJzjsYDNylq6scwOOMXhd1O-2BkWpA4CERtKWinqO6PRadXfzykqk-2FV8O6f4FPEoqpQxcbXpZxUpFK-2Fldxt-2FMqZ8RlaBl9kak-2FfAEdXR6GIAhv788OPCsJYM93bmZYGIs5coW14plvIrTCQEwTXzzyE9Axvwmjm-2BOZco6G8BIKlLGloCG8YglU7LPXvIPj82ZzNRbXIjNglPfCncdPuWEtYp-2FOkBvQgU7Orx5ZF9vMtkO8ovNVZpac-2FZJ1K73b-2FFYpZS9BCK1KvrCiYmj65CA-3D-3D)

title: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy

communications.subject: Alaska Public Records Act Request: Alaska DOC Adult Pay to Stay Policy
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Alaska Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

The following materials regarding the imposition, assessment, collection and balances of inmate fees and debt:

a) All current policies and procedures regarding medical and room & board costs or fees for which inmates are or may become liable. Please include all policies and procedures related to how fees are set, accrued, imposed, collected, and enforced (such as those related to per diem fees, ability to pay determinations, penalties for late or non-payment, authorization for civil or criminal action for payment enforcement, etc). 

b) All reports, databases, spreadsheets, or equivalent materials regarding debts/restitution paid to or owed to this department or any facility/agency under its jurisdiction in FY2021. Please include all relevant data regarding medical and room & board costs, including the number of individuals charged for medical and room & board costs or fees and the total amount of medical and room & board fees imposed in FY2021.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Mercy Loyo
